io.github.utk003.json.scanner

Interface Scanner

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JSONScanner, OOJTranslator.JSONValueStreamer

    public interface Scanner
    An interface for tokenizing a given input into valid JSON tokens

    Scanners can take JSON input in any form, whether as a Stream, a Reader, or in another way.

    JSONScanner is a default implementation of Scanner, and it is also used by this library to tokenize JSON inputs.

    Version:
    February 2, 2021
    Author:
    Utkarsh Priyam (utk003)
    See Also:
    JSONScanner, Reader, Stream

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String advance()
      Advances to and returns the next token for this Scanner
      String current()
      Returns the current token associated with this Scanner
      boolean hasMore()
      Returns whether or not there are any more tokens to be parsed
      long tokensPassed()
      Returns the number of tokens that have been returned so far

    • Method Detail

      • hasMore

        boolean hasMore()
        Returns whether or not there are any more tokens to be parsed
        Returns:
        true, if there are more tokens to parse; otherwise, false

      • tokensPassed

        long tokensPassed()
        Returns the number of tokens that have been returned so far

        A token counts as being returned every time a new token is returned by this Scanner. In other words, this value should represent the number of times that advance() is called.

        Returns:
        The number of tokens that have been returned
        See Also:
        advance()

      • current

        String current()
        Returns the current token associated with this Scanner

        The current token for this Scanner is defined as the most recent token returned by advance(). If advance() has never been called before, then the return value of this method is undefined and may not be consistent across implementations.

        Returns:
        This Scanner's current token, if one exists
        See Also:
        advance()

      • advance

        String advance()
        Advances to and returns the next token for this Scanner

        If hasMore() returns false, then the return value for this method is undefined. This method can return null, the previous token, or even throw an exception.

        Returns:
        This Scanner's next token, if one exists
        See Also:
        hasMore()
